intro.description: Create a New Language Module A Language Module is used to store words and phrases on a similar topic.

item.title: Start the New Language Module Wizard
item.description: Choose File->New Language Module from the menu.

item.title: Choose where to save the Language Module
item.description: Click Browse... to choose the container for the Language Module. This will normally be under your User Project or a sub-folder of it.

item.title: Name the Language Module
item.description:
Give the Language Module a file name. This should reflect the Topic of the module.
Click Finish.

item.title: Create a Test Item
item.description: The Test Module Editor should have openned in the centre of the window.

subitem.label: Click at the top of the column just below the title of your own language. Type the meaning of a word or phrase in your own language.
Click at the top of the column just below the title of the language which you are learning. Type the word or phrase that you want to learn.

You can also add an image to your Test Item. Click at the top of the Picture column. A ... button should appear. Click on this to browse to a picture in JPEG, GIF or PNG format. This picture will be displayed below in the Language Test view. This is a preview of what the Test Item will look like during a test.

item.title: Configuring the languages
item.description:
You can configure the languages which are displayed in the columns in the Language Module Editor by clicking on the Languages tab beneath the editor.
Click on the Enabled, Font or Font size cells to modify the value.
When you have finished click on the Test Items tab beneath the editor to display the Test Item table again.

item.title: Recording
item.description: Record your language helper or teacher saying this word or phrase.

subitem.label: Switch to the Record Audio view by clicking on its tab in the bottom page.
Click on the circle to start recording. A sound filename will automatically be selected. Click the square to stop recording.
Play back your recording to check it is OK by clicking on the Triangle.
To re-Record, just click the circle as before. You will be prompted whether you want to overwrite the recording.

Convert your recording to a compressed File format.
You will need to configure this first, which may require you to download and install additional programs. You can configure this from the Preferences dialogue.
You can then choose a different format from the Wave drop-down list.

item.title: Add additional Items
item.description: You can add Additional Test Items in the same way. Just click in the appropriate column underneath the first Test Item.

item.title: Save
item.description: From the menu choose File->Save to save your changes.
